TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit SoapHeaderException extends System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException

Docs.summary: The SOAP representation of a server error.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When an XML Web service client adds a SOAP header to an XML Web service method call with the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader.MustUnderstand%2A> property set to `true`, the XML Web service method must set the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader.DidUnderstand%2A> property to `true`; otherwise, a SoapHeaderException is thrown.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Detail%2A> property cannot be set according to the SOAP specification for a SoapHeaderException.
> [!NOTE] > Applications that use the SOAP 1.1 specification as the service protocol can use the SoapHeaderException to access SOAP faults. However, applications that use the SOAP 1.2 specification must use the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException> to access SOAP faults.
## Examples In the following example, an XML Web service client calls the `MyWebMethod` XML Web service method, passing in a SOAP header of type `MyHeader` with the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader.MustUnderstand%2A> property set to `true`. If the XML Web service method does not set the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader.DidUnderstand%2A> property of the `MyHeader` SOAP header to `true`, a SoapHeaderException is thrown.
[!code-cs[Classic SoapHeader.MustUnderstand Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.services.pr_5_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic SoapHeader.MustUnderstand Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.services.pr_5_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Classic SoapHeader.MustUnderstand Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.web.services.pr_5_1.cpp)]

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName code, string actor, string role, class System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode subCode, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: A message that identifies the reason the exception occurred. This parameter sets the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property.
The type of error that occurred. This parameter sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Code%2A> property.
The piece of code that caused the exception. Typically, this is a URL to an XML Web service method. This parameter sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Actor%2A> property.
An URI that represents the role of the XML Web service in the processing of the SOAP message. This parameter sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Role%2A> property.
A that contains the contents of the element of a SOAP fault.
A reference to the root cause of the exception. This parameter sets the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName code, string actor, string role, string lang, class System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode subCode, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: A message that identifies the reason the exception occurred. This parameter sets the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property.
The type of error that occurred. This parameter sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Code%2A> property.
The piece of code that caused the exception. Typically, this is a URL to an XML Web service method. This parameter sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Actor%2A> property.
An URI that represents the role of the XML Web service in the processing of the SOAP message. This parameter sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Role%2A> property.
A string that identifies the human language associated with the exception. This parameter sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Lang%2A> property.
A that contains the contents of the element of a SOAP fault.
A reference to the root cause of an exception. This parameter sets the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.
